item.title: About Quality Bytes: Your Partner for Future-Proof Software Solutions
item.description:
WHY QUALITY BYTES

✅ Long-Term Commitment:
We don’t believe in one-off projects or cookie-cutter solutions. Our mission is to build strong, lasting partnerships. Many of our clients have trusted us for years: we know their software inside out, have developed complete products for them, and continue to drive meaningful progress together. That’s what makes us a true partner – not just another vendor.

✅ Technical Excellence:
.NET MAUI, TX Text Control, Blazor, ASP.NET, SAP ODATA Services, MongoDB & Azure are our core technologies. Founded and led by a Microsoft MVP, book author, and active open source contributor (e.g., in the .NET MAUI project), we combine deep architectural expertise with direct connections to the teams behind the technologies that drive your success. We deliver pragmatic solutions built to last.

item.title: Document Automation with TX Text Control | Quality Bytes GmbH
Xamarin.Forms to .NET MAUI Migration Services | Quality Bytes
.NET MAUI Mobile Apps for Business | Custom Development By Quality Bytes
Raygun instead of AppCenter for .NET MAUI: Analytics and Crash Reporting made easy
item.description:
In March 2024, Microsoft announced the retirement of Visual Studio AppCenter, effective March 31, 2025. While AppCenter has been a reliable platform for mobile app developers over the years, its upcoming shutdown means it’s time to explore new options.

In our recent blog post on the AppCenter retirement, we highlighted that there is no single solution available that encompasses all of AppCenter’s features—Build, Test, Distribute, Analytics, and Crash Diagnostics. Instead, developers must seek out specialized tools for each function.

item.title: Microsoft App Center is being retired - What .NET MAUI developers need to know now
item.description:
Content:

  • App Center
  • App Center Features
  • Impact on .NET MAUI Developers from App Center’s Discontinuation
  • Alternatives to App Center

Mobile app development is driven by numerous complex infrastructure tasks that typically operate unseen by the end user yet are vital to the app’s quality. These tasks include establishing and managing automated build and deployment processes, conducting tests on real devices, analyzing user data, and capturing detailed diagnostic data when an app crashes on a user device.

item.title: Creating users in Azure SQL DB
item.description:
After creating a database under Microsoft Azure, the next step is usually to create a user who is to be authorized in the corresponding database.

Unfortunately, there is currently no direct option for this in the web interface of the Azure portal. Only the admin user for the DB server can be configured there. For security reasons, however, this should not be the user with which you later access the database from your own application.

item.title: Reinforcement as Software Developer .NET, Frontend Developer Angular, Xamarin Developer or ASP.NET Core Developer wanted
item.description:
This might be your new desk

For our team in Sinzig at the Rhine, between Bonn and Koblenz, we are looking for several software developers with immediate effect. We develop exciting customer solutions in the web and mobile environment in a team of four developers.

In doing so, we rely on modern technologies, tools, and approaches, such as

  • ASP.NET Core
  • Angular
  • Xamarin
  • Azure DevOps
  • git
  • Unit Testing
  • Typescript
  • C#

We currently have various positions available. Among others, we are looking for three .NET developers who can either develop ASP.NET Core or Xamarin or both, and a frontend developer with a focus on Angular.

item.title: Privacy
item.description:
As of 21. January 2022

Privacy Policy

Preamble

With the following privacy policy, we would like to inform you which types of your personal data (hereinafter also abbreviated as “data”) we process for which purposes and in which scope. The privacy statement applies to all processing of personal data carried out by us, both in the context of providing our services and in particular on our websites, in mobile applications, and within external online presences, such as our social media profiles (hereinafter collectively referred to as “online services”).
